Comment: Nationwide lockdown in Germany, including Rheinland-Pfalz, with strict measures such as social distancing, closure of non-essential businesses, schools, and public gatherings, and travel restrictions.
Gradual easing of restrictions, with some businesses and schools reopening, but with continued social distancing and hygiene measures in place.
Mandatory use of masks in public transport and certain public areas.
Increase in COVID-19 cases leading to regional lockdowns and restrictions on social gatherings.

"Emergency brake" measures introduced to tighten restrictions in areas with high infection rates.
Phased reopening of schools with a combination of in-person and remote learning.
Further easing of restrictions, including the reopening of outdoor dining, cultural venues, and sports facilities.
Continued relaxation of measures, with further reopening of businesses and relaxation of mask-wearing requirements in certain areas.
Introduction of a "3G" rule (tested, vaccinated, recovered) for certain indoor activities.
Gradual easing of restrictions, with some businesses and schools reopening, but with continued social distancing and hygiene measures in place.
Lifting of mask-wearing requirements in certain areas, but with continued emphasis on social distancing and hygiene measures.
Relaxation of restrictions on gatherings and events, with larger gatherings allowed with certain conditions.
